greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: If n is the i-th prime, p_i = A000040(i), then a(n) = i, otherwise the difference between the indices of the smallest and the largest prime dividing n: for n = p_i * ... * p_k, where p_i <= ... <= p_k, a(n) = (k-i); a(1) = 0 by convention.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
xref: Useful when computing A243057 or A243059.
A025475 (prime powers that are not primes) gives the positions of zeros.
Differs from A241917 for the first time at n=18.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, May 31 2014
